definition: to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
the side/to incline towards/to lean/inclined/lateral/side
lean on one side
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]

sentences.english: I mean, I was just winging it, But that's good.
sentences.chinese: 真的？是吗，我只是旁敲侧击了下，不错。

sentences.english: Cunning suspicious of her to Ye Lingqing again after the beat about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 之后，狡猾多疑的她又对叶凌青旁敲侧击。

sentences.english: She insinuated to us that her partner had embezzled funds.
sentences.chinese: 她旁敲侧击地指出她的合伙人盗用了资金。

sentences.english: Don't beat around the bush! What do you want to say?
sentences.chinese: 不要旁敲侧击了，你想说什么？

sentences.english: Cheng Yakun attack by innuendo, the total can not directly said to be him.
sentences.chinese: 成亚坤旁敲侧击，总不能直接说是他吧。

definition: to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to sound sb out/to find out by tactful indirect questioning
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to inquire into/to ask after
intentionally or otherwise
overtly and secretly/explicitly and implicitly
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
